version_description:
iOS 13 is now supported!

Additional bug fixes and performance improvements include:
- iOS 13 devices can now be set as "trusted", and authenticated from a pre-trusted device, with two-step verification
- Resolved an issue with the app crashing at launch
- Geofencing status displays correctly, including in bad network conditions
- 3D Touch menu is restored
- Fixed a message regarding CVR for devices without Arlo Smart when AC power has been disconnected
- CVR video can now be played back if the camera is offline
- HomeKit-related fixes

iOS 13 is now supported! 

Additional bug fixes and performance improvements include:

- Home screen badge count now resets correctly
- Resolved an issue with the app crashing at launch
- Geofencing status displays correctly, including in bad network conditions
- 3D Touch menu is restored
- Fixed a message regarding CVR for devices without Arlo Smart when AC power has been disconnected
- CVR video can now be played back if the camera is offline
- HomeKit-related fixes

NEW FEATURE : Two Step Verification - Add an extra layer of security to your account. Activate from within Settings > Profile > Login Settings to require a secondary form of authentication for logins to unrecognized devices.*

If you had our previous app (now named “Arlo Legacy”), your account and camera settings will automatically transfer over when you sign in to this app. “Call a Friend” for Arlo Smart subscribers, mobile devices enabled for Geofencing, and settings specific to your iOS device will both need to be set up again.

*Our next release will return support for “trusting” new iOS 13 devices authenticated with two-step verification, and will also re-enable support for verification from previously trusted devices. To pass a two-step verification check with your iOS 13 device on version 2.9 of the Arlo app, please use SMS or email verification. After installing the upcoming version, please log out and log back in to add your iOS 13 device to the list of trusted devices.

iOS 13 is now supported!

Additional bug fixes and performance improvements include:
- iOS 13 devices can now be set as "trusted", and authenticated from a pre-trusted device, with two-step verification
- Resolved an issue with the app crashing at launch
- Geofencing status displays correctly, including in bad network conditions
- 3D Touch menu is restored
- Fixed a message regarding CVR for devices without Arlo Smart when AC power has been disconnected
- CVR video can now be played back if the camera is offline
- HomeKit-related fixes

New Features:
- Dark Mode for iOS 13 has arrived! Enabled from iOS system settings, streaming a camera or checking a video recording is easier on your eyes with Dark Mode, especially at night. We’ve also freshened up some of the UI colors within the app.

-HomeKit support for Arlo Ultra cameras, as well as Pro2 and Pro cameras connected to a SmartHub (VMB5000).

- Two-step Verification: We’ve made it easier to add and manage trusted devices and methods.

- Change Email Address: Located within Profile > Login Settings, you can now update your Arlo account email address.

Bug Fixes:
- Resolved a crash on some iOS 10.3.x devices
- Pressing the Audio Doorbell button did not always result in a call
- Devices could get stuck on “Getting Status”
- Audio sometimes continued to play after a video clip was closed
- “Select all & Delete” works again in the Library
- Downloaded videos showed an incorrect time stamp
- Other stability and performance improvements

Additionally, over the past few weeks, we’ve resolved some bugs at the server-level, including notifications without recordings and recordings outside of activity zones.

Introducing the Arlo Video Doorbell! Know before they knock with a 180-degree wide-angle view, so you can clearly see both faces and packages, and quickly respond to visitors.

The Arlo Video Doorbell is shipping soon - visit arlo.com for more details.

Also in this release:
- The Devices screen loads significantly faster
- Bug fixes for iOS 10.3
- Improvements to Dark Mode
- Resolved an issue with IFTTT integration
- Other stability and performance improvements

This release supports the following NEW FEATURES:

Assistant PIN: Arm and disarm Arlo SmartHubs and base stations via verbal commands to voice assistants, starting with Alexa-powered devices. To setup Assistant PIN, go to Settings > Profile > Assistant PIN. (Base stations and SmartHubs supported: VMB3000, VMB3500, VMB4000, VMB4500, VMB4540, and VMB5000).

Direct Storage Access (requires SmartHub and a third-party storage device): Advanced users can access recordings saved locally to their SmartHub directly within the Arlo app. Enable Direct Storage Access in SmartHub Settings > Storage Settings. (Note - router configuration may be required for accessing clips outside the home. VMB4540 or VMB5000 required.)

Additional bug fixes and performance improvements include:
- Geofencing should function more reliably for most users
- Audio from other apps will continue to play when the Arlo app is opened
- Missed doorbell calls appear in the system phone call history
- Arlo Video Doorbell : The currently connected Wi-Fi SSID on your iOS device is populated when onboarding the doorbell (2.4Ghz SSID is required)
- Other general stability and performance improvements
